Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in applying a deferential standard of review to the RPD's decision
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed refugee protection but were denied by the RPD and RAD
Decision_Outcome: Application for judicial review allowed in part
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review citing bias and improper standard of review
Court_Ruling: Case remanded to RAD for reconsideration under the correct standard of review
Defendant_Behavior: RAD applied a deferential standard to the RPD's credibility assessment
Legal_Standard: RAD must conduct a complete review of questions of fact, law, and mixed fact and law
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review applied by RAD
Review_Standard: Complete review required; reasonableness standard improperly applied
Credibility_Assessment: RPD's credibility assessment was given undue deference by RAD
Application_Basis: Refugee protection under Canadian immigration law
Relief_Sought: Redetermination by a differently constituted panel of the RAD
Governing_Rule: RAD must not apply a deferential standard but conduct a full appellate review
Outcome: Matter returned to a differently constituted panel of the RAD for redetermination
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board â€“ Refugee Appeal Division (RAD)
Cause_Description: Applicants claimed refugee protection but were denied due to alleged errors in review standard and potential bias
Decision_Rationale: RAD failed to fully review factual and legal issues; incorrect standard of review applied
